website_summaries.verdict: Organizes smaller tools and parts in customizable drawers, and is somewhat portable, but its lid, latches, and hinges are a bit flimsy.
pros: A roomy toolbox on the top, with several clear plastic pull-out drawers beneath it
Drawer dividers can be moved around for a custom fit
cons: Front and top covers feel flimsy
Limited number of dividers included, and additional ones aren’t available

customer_reviews.title: Great for Arduino Electronics Parts
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a simple box for storing all of the small parts I use for Arduino electronics projects. This is perfect for someone starting out with Arduino. It is a small box but it holds quite a bit and really makes it easy to keep everything organized. Take a look at the photos I uploaded to get an idea of relative size. The width of compartments can be adjusted with dividers and the top storage area is great for larger parts including breadboards and the Arduino itself.
customer_reviews.author: JRich

customer_reviews.title: Small but good
customer_reviews.text: Good little box. Key is little. Wasn't what I expected but I will still use it
customer_reviews.author: Tom

customer_reviews.title: Perfect... Made in USA
customer_reviews.text: I run a small woodworking business that specializes in wood art and furniture. I have tons of different small finishing nails and screws, and I needed a solution to organize them that would also keep out dust. This was perfect. Bonus, Made in USA...
customer_reviews.author: joshua whaley

customer_reviews.title: Plano Quality, The main picture does not show how small it is!
customer_reviews.text: I'm using it as a sewing basket. Since I'm a guy I didn't want a pink flowery thing. It's smaller than I imagined. I wish the pictures would have some standard references so you can see at a glance what it really is. -1 star for that. The price in Canada was ridiculously high so I imported it from USA. My shopping two cents is if it's made in US, Canada or Mexico take advantage of the NAFTA and bypass the crazy retailers that charges 300% for the exact same item.
customer_reviews.author: chosebine

customer_reviews.title: This tool box is GREAT for electronics projects including Raspberry Pi and Arduino
customer_reviews.text: This tool box is GREAT for electronics projects including Raspberry Pi and Arduino. It is extremely easy to organize items, include small objects like capacitors, sensors, resistors, etc. The top part is great for stowing away commonly used tools for soldering like my iron, wire cutters, pliers, etc. Don't hesitate to buy. It is a great quality product!
customer_reviews.author: ds

customer_reviews.title: Very sturdy, compact, well proportioned item.
customer_reviews.text: This item is all plastic but feels very well made. The size is perfect for something like a dremmel and its various bits. The only problem I had was that the drawer partition strips do not snap cleanly apart from each other (they come in a strip of several) and the excess plastic made them not sit correctly and in some cases inhibited lid closure. Easily solved with a razor blade utility knife, as the plastic is soft and easy to cut. But it did get a little annoying to have to shave excess bits of plastic off every single divider. Overall I am 99% happy with this item at this price point.
customer_reviews.author: DrowsyKitten

customer_reviews.title: Great box! Durable.
customer_reviews.text: Awesome. I keep all of my daughters medicine and medical supplies inside. This is perfect for us on the go.
customer_reviews.author: Cierra

customer_reviews.title: Definitely helps organize loose parts
customer_reviews.text: I'm using it for storing screws and nuts/bolts, as well as electrical crimps and nuts. The flexibility of adjusting the compartment sizes is great and upper compartment for tools works perfect. Only reason I'm giving 4 instead of 5 stars is the handle system isn't very robust. Guessing this isn't made for relatively moderate weight. As its plastic with short-ish pins to hold in place and it does have a minor locking tab system when the handle is up, but with the containers < half full with screws so maybe 4-5lbs, I've had the handle detach a couple times. I'm not just more careful when picking up but wish it was a bit more robust.
customer_reviews.author: vietsb

customer_reviews.title: Small but efficient
customer_reviews.text: If you check the dimensions you will know that this is not a big box. I do a lot of network wiring, patch cables and other work and this is perfect. I can keep my tools on the top compartment and all the other stuff fits perfect in the 4 sectional boxes that come with it. It fits perfect in my car without being to bulky to carry in to the job site. If you are planning on using this for fishing tackle, you might want to find something bigger unless you don't carry much tackle.
customer_reviews.author: Ruben Murillo Jr.

customer_reviews.title: difficult
customer_reviews.text: the dividers slide out at the slightest touch, spilling the contents of one section into another, and the bumps and slide slots for the dividers have sharp points that scrape the hands up as items are reached for. its not as deep as I had hoped and doesn't carry as much as I need it to. because the warning about cancerous material is buried so deep in the page that I missed the notice, I'm extremely unhappy with that, but that's Amazon's fault for not posting it up front. the sharp edges need removed, the dividers need to fit tightly, and the cancerous material needs removed.
customer_reviews.author: Cornelia G. Moore

customer_reviews.title: Good deal... but top compartment is a bit flimsy
customer_reviews.text: I do like that this case comes with 4 smaller cases with customizable compartments. I will say, however, that the top compartment is a bit flimsy, and sometimes will not latch properly if you load it up. Having said that, the case works well, and I use it to store jewelry supplies. It is worrisome that the top handle is connected to the top compartment though, so you have to ensure that the top compartment is latched properly, lest the top compartment contents will come flying out. Good deal.
customer_reviews.author: Denton

customer_reviews.title: SHOCKED
customer_reviews.text: When I opened this I was disappointed, I thought that there is no way I can fit anything in it. I was WRONG. I had a tool box that was wide, awkwardly shaped, and deep with just one shelf, it was a disaster. I consider myself to be Marie Condo-eque organized, so the toolbox was my one shame. This toolbox fixed all my problems! I was so impressed that I was able to fit EVERYTHING besides ONE extra long hammer.
customer_reviews.author: Roshamas

customer_reviews.title: It's okay.
customer_reviews.text: Overall, it's not a terrible mini sized toolbox that you can store items in. My containers came with warped walls/dividers so the pieces you can slide into place don't stay in place. As well as the packaging when it arrived was not as secure as I would have hoped and a corner piece of this tool box is broken as seen in the photo I attached. Not as satisfied as I would have hoped but you get what you pay for!
customer_reviews.author: Joshua

customer_reviews.title: great for storing rpg paints for miniatures with a bit of work
customer_reviews.text: fantastic for storing rpg paints (with a bit of modification). I removed the smallest tray and bought another of the larger trays (sold separately) for the top compartment. I removed the box tops for each larger compartment and then using a large xacto knife removed the supports for the smallest tray so that i can fit two large compartments fulll of paint into the lower storage space (see attached photos)
customer_reviews.author: Allen Dodger

customer_reviews.title: It's a storage box thing
customer_reviews.text: This thing holds stuff like you wouldn't even believe. I mean, you got a thing that's small enough to fit in it? Forget about it, it'll hold it like nothin. Wanna put stuff in and close it? THIS BOX WILL DO IT FOR YOU. Open? Yes. Close? Yes. IT DOES BOTH. One of my kids was drowning in the pool the other day and this box jumped in to save them. This box was the best man at my wedding.
customer_reviews.author: fedaalis

customer_reviews.title: Read the dimensions!!
customer_reviews.text: I purchase this tackle box for my husband's birthday. When the box came it was barely bigger than a shoe box. This is the smallest tackle box I have ever seen. This might be good for someone who makes their own jewelry or likes to store small beads. Oops. Oh well I gave it to my son and daughter for their own tiny tackle box like dad's regular sized one.
customer_reviews.author: Blayk M

customer_reviews.title: It All Fit
customer_reviews.text: We've had a smaller version of Plano Moulding's cases at work for a long time. I bought this larger one for keeping track of a bunch of my Raspberry Pi computer parts. A couple of complete systems with cases, spare parts and small battery backs all fit nicely. Even had room for a RPi keyboard in the top of the case. It would be nice if a couple of the horizontal walls in one or two of the shelves/boxes could be removed to make some bigger spaces, but I managed to get it all organized. I like it!
customer_reviews.author: Bob G.

customer_reviews.title: Handy storage unit
customer_reviews.text: Ordered this unit to store separately, antique clock repair parts. It's working out quite well. First is easy to move or store. Rather rugged with good latches. Three slide out containers which latch with build your own size compartments . Bottom compartment is larger and a big top open shelve for bigger items. Well engineered and useful for smaller hard to store and find items.
customer_reviews.author: USNoldChief

customer_reviews.title: Nice little organizer for computer fittings/piping.
customer_reviews.text: Pay attention to the dimensions- it was smaller than I had expected. Otherwise - it is what it appears to be. Sturdy little box with lots of compartments that you can install included dividers into for a custom kind of set up. I bought it for p c parts after hunting for left over thumb screws after losing one from my previous rebuild and want to organize.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Diamond painting supply holder
customer_reviews.text: This is our 2nd one of these. First held parts and tools for Warhammer 40k for almost 10 years now. No issues, no chipping, no cracking, not really even any fading. Got a 2nd for the new hobby. Plenty of space for small parts, 4 storage boxes helps spread things out. Top holds paints or other supplies. Small scissors should fit on the top. About 3 inches of space clearance. Helpful to keep organized.
customer_reviews.author: DT

customer_reviews.title: It has held up nicely. It fits everything perfectly
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to organize my socket sets and the tools I use for working on my cars. It has held up nicely. It fits everything perfectly. The separator tabs are kind of an issue. They don't pull apart very easily and you have to shave a little plastic nub off to get them to fit but it's worth it. The top is deep enough for a lot of socket wrenches, clamps and even my impact drill (portable rigid drill with battery). The drawers are great for the sockets themselves. It seems to be able to handle the weight i have in it just fine. But it if you are looking for a great organizer for your socket sets.
customer_reviews.author: J.S.B.

customer_reviews.title: Overall not bad for the money
customer_reviews.text: This is not a horrible tackle box. It is a little small for what I thought it was going to be but regardless it’s pretty good. The front lid is a little on the thin and cheap side but again it’s not horrible for the price you pay. Storage is actually pretty good, the top box could be a little bigger or deeper, could only fit two reels of line a pliers and a fold up knife. No more room for gloves at any other type of plier tools fisherman use.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Depeau

customer_reviews.title: Just Right
customer_reviews.text: Just right for me. We don’t see often and got this to hold our sewing supplies. It held everything. The caution here would be organization. We were short on dividers for the trays. Still, we got everything tidy. Marie Kondo would approve. The top compartment held all the big items well. When I get a machine, that is where I’ll keep the feet and a bobbin tray.
customer_reviews.author: Rob

customer_reviews.title: Buy new only...
customer_reviews.text: This would have been a great storage case for lure making supplies, but I bought an “open box” version for slightly less money and received a previously opened (expected) unit that was missing all of the Plano boxes. Apparently there is a scam in operation- buy only new so you are not disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: Easy access to tools and parts
customer_reviews.text: Totally pleased with this toolbox. It replaced an ancient small hand toolbox that could not hold essential tools, and parts (screws, nuts, washers, etc.) were simply thrown into the bottom. The Plano has everything organized and readily accessible. Sometimes I wonder (briefly) whether I should have bought instead the Plano model with four (thinner) drawers.
customer_reviews.author: gray ghost

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for
customer_reviews.text: The first one I got had the hinges deformed as if a hot rod had fallen on it. The replacement was fine. Each container has only 8 dividers when there are 10 slots. The dividers are so loose that taking anything out, they lift up, mixing everything. I surely will have to glue them down. My awful containers made in China have better dividers. I wouldn't recommend this for anyone who wants to store tiny electronic components. The 2 stars are only for the price and the locks.
customer_reviews.author: Miki

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Hobby / Hardware Box
customer_reviews.text: I am using this box to store small hobby parts (small gears, springs, model wheels / axels, etc); but this box would also make a great hardware, art supply, bead / jewelry or sewing organizer. Regardless of what its used for, if your work area is chaotic and needs organizing, this box is the answer.
customer_reviews.author: Jimmy B

customer_reviews.title: Useful for small items.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for storing sewing supplies + This is a decent organizing box and is very portable. Great for small thread spools. And small notions. This box is great for multiple small items like maybe jewelry making supplies. - only one deep space to put odd shaped, larger items in it so I was forced to take out the bottom box for extra storage. It kind of works. Also, the craftsmanship of the box is only fair. Not excellent as I would expect from an American made product.
customer_reviews.author: Tracy

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for batteries!
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for holding batteries! I keep my charger in the top box, then use the four smaller boxes to store batteries by type. I have one for non-rechargeable non-lithium-ion batteries, one for rechargeable non-lithium-ion batteries, one for non-rechargeable lithium-ion batteries, and one for rechargeable lithium-ion batteries. The boxes and dividers are perfect sizes for all the common batteries and are just narrow enough to keep the batteries pointing the same direction and their contacts from touching each other.
customer_reviews.author: Steven

customer_reviews.title: So Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: As a builder of small electronic devices I have a lot of small tools and a collection of meters that I use regularly. With a place for the meters in the top bay and pull out covered drawers with movable dividers for the tools I got the perfect toolbox. In spite of plastic construction the toolbox is ruggedly built with firmly closing latches. While my use of this toolbox leaves it mostly on my workbench, I have no doubt that it would travel well. It's a perfect size and easily carried. The price was surprisingly low for the value it offers leaving me feeling really good about my decision to buy it.
customer_reviews.author: bk

customer_reviews.title: Smaller than it looks on the PC
customer_reviews.text: Decent quality. Good for storing medical supplies like pills ointments, q-tips etc. I bought my son one to store small Lego parts in. Good to store picture frame hanger hardware, screw and the like. Would make a good small tackle box. Compartments too small to use as a tool box.
customer_reviews.author: Coosa

customer_reviews.title: The interior translucent boxes are fine. But the outter case is very cheap
customer_reviews.text: I guess i expected a little more. This is not a quality product. The interior translucent boxes are fine. But the outter case is very cheap. Handle will fall out of the lid. The latches that hold the face cover are flimsy and weak. This product isnt mde for a construction worker looking to store small parts. Think grandmas sewing items sitting on a cabinet. It doesnt stand up to any abuse or rugged usage
customer_reviews.author: Roddy

customer_reviews.title: Great portable storage!
customer_reviews.text: Nice little box! I use it to store my PC hardware, such as screws and cables and what have you. Nice to have when you need to build or tweak any PC. Small enough to carry around with ease. The only issue is that it doesn't come with the proper number of dividers for the bigger compartments. That really needs to be addressed.
customer_reviews.author: Slork

customer_reviews.title: Plenty of storage in compact design
customer_reviews.text: A lot smaller than I thought it would be, but perfect for a first tackle box. Has plenty of storage in a compact size and a small hole to lock the top compartment. The slide out trays have adjustable seperaters. Only negative is majority of it is plastic.
customer_reviews.author: Leala

customer_reviews.title: Great Small Box
customer_reviews.text: This is a perfect holding box for a modest selection of screws and bolts. My only concern is the front panel that folds up and down to secure the four clear boxes. Step on that once by accident while it is open and it might snap off no problem, but the rest of the unit appears to be fairly durable. I've had good luck with Plano products lasting 15-20 years and I expect this item will be no different.
customer_reviews.author: Oberon

customer_reviews.title: Good for beginning jewelry metalwork
customer_reviews.text: I am starting a comprehensive class on jewelry metalwork. Although it must be said that the case is really, really ugly, it's also quite functional and perfect for this stage. The top space is wide and deep enough to hold my metals, safety glasses, dust masks, jewelry saw, and a few other things. The plastic drawers come with dividers that nicely separate little things like drill bits from longer tools like files. It seems solid and I like that it is light. I'm glad I bought it. I had initially ordered a big cantilever thing but it turned out to be really heavy and way more than i needed, so I returned it.
customer_reviews.author: pinelady

customer_reviews.title: Good for what I wanted
customer_reviews.text: I actually use this for storing mini's for the pathfinder (D&D like) system. I have a bunch of them, and this is a really nice easy way to store a lot of minis, and take them with me when I need to. I really like that the partitions in the small cases are easy to move, since I don't need them to all be the same size.
customer_reviews.author: Lyle Eckert

customer_reviews.title: ... this was a bit bigger but overall I am happy with it
customer_reviews.text: I too thought this was a bit bigger but overall I am happy with it. I am using it for jewelry making pieces and not tackle. The cost of these things in the jewelry section are ridiculous. The dividers allowed me to store things the way I wanted. I was able to take all kinds of small pieces I use out form little bags and other haphazard storage methods and get organized. The storage up top was great for the tools I used too.
customer_reviews.author: nini

customer_reviews.title: Nice , sturdy  it's a must buy
customer_reviews.text: Not bad at all ! A little smaller than anticipated but will work for my need , For the price you cannot go wrong ! Its sturdy, made very well and that being said I think I'm going to get a couple more. Because for the price I cant afford not to.
customer_reviews.author: larry pollard

customer_reviews.title: Nice . The idea to remove permanent dividers and let the owner decided where they need to go
customer_reviews.text: Perfect the only thing i would suggest to not have permanent dividers. To only have divider that you can choose where they go no perment ones . I got a hot knife wood burner to remove mine . Smd now its very perfect .
customer_reviews.author: Ann barlow

customer_reviews.title: Little larger than what I was expecting!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace one that I've had for years and loved... Guess I should have measured the old one. This one is huge in comparison. Guess I'll end up using it for a different project. I'm the end it's still a great container and uSA made!
customer_reviews.author: 4acae86

customer_reviews.title: It is very small as said in other reviews
customer_reviews.text: I was expecting a small item having read the reviews but must say this was tiny. Be warned that subtracting the molding / fab details from the overall size reduces it even further and with something this small the reduction is meaningful. Being a good price I figured I try this but I would not order another one.
customer_reviews.author: lensop

customer_reviews.title: Nice Hobby/Tool Storage Box
customer_reviews.text: Nice case for carrying my hobby supplies. Has decent storage capacity but don't expect a lot of room for larger items. It's well made and serves it's purpose well. Good for storing small tools and hobby supplies but not large enough to hold a bunch of stuff if you need it. I like it.
customer_reviews.author: vurt

customer_reviews.title: Kind of flimsy
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to store lavalier microphone materials for attaching to the talent, but I was disappointed in the flemsiness of the front drop down. It doesn't look like it's going to last at all.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Plano-Stow-N-Go works for so much stuff!
customer_reviews.text: Bought my first Stow-n-Go several years ago for a fishing box...then another for a 'small-parts' garage box...my wife has one for her arts-and-crafts stuff, and now that she's dropped off into 'airbrush artwork', I got her this one to put all her fittings, needles, nozzles, hoses and gadgets into... Great hobby boxes, as well as everything else you can use them for!
customer_reviews.author: Melanie C

customer_reviews.title: Holds tons of smaller items like board game counters/tokens
customer_reviews.text: Item EXACTLY as described. This is one of the smaller configurations that they make and I own many different sizes. Holds tons of smaller items like board game counters/tokens, wargame miniatures, beads, jewelry, sewing supplies, etc. It is sturdy enough to sit on, although you would be close to the ground. Compare the price to buying just the storage boxes separate. This is a good deal. Be sure to note the dimensions, lots of negative reviews by people that fail to READ.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Read the dimensions!
customer_reviews.text: I failed to read the dimensions. This thing is really small. The stock photos make it seem larger. I originally purchased this to store hardware. I was only able to store small screws in this box, which is a good use for this small box.
customer_reviews.author: Chism

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for automotive wiring terminals
customer_reviews.text: I was tired of hunting in different places throughout my shop for wiring terminals so scanned the internet for the perfect container and found this. PERFECT! I love that the top of the box holds 2 ammeters and 2 probes, misc clips etc. Each bin box offers adjustable dividers that fit firmly into place and don't fall out like others. Once filled, the lid locks into place with 2 firm snaps. Once you're done, the drop down front snaps into place and has 2 locks to hold it there. Maybe I'm gushing, but this is way nicer and much higher quality than I expected to get for the money!
customer_reviews.author: PNW Shopper

customer_reviews.title: Versatile and well made
customer_reviews.text: I work in a software engineering department where we write software that interacts with various hardware/circuits that require us to do wiring with some basic electronics. Our offices recently moved and our cubicles were scaled down a bit so I needed something to better organize the hand tools I keep at my desk and the various small parts we use. This case is perfect for what I needed. The bins can be configured to allow the compartments to be various sizes. The quality matches what I expected from Plano given past purchases.
customer_reviews.author: imnorm

customer_reviews.title: Perfect size for my needs, this is not a large one
customer_reviews.text: Turned out to be perfect for my needs. I repair all major appliances and got my needed tools for initial diagnosis down to reasonable number including multimeter and amp meter. Everything fit in here with a little room to grow. The two bottom parts bins are deeper than the top. Perfect combination for me. I am disappointed with the latches that hold the parts bins in, but they work, latch for lid/carry handle plenty strong,
customer_reviews.author: swani2002

customer_reviews.title: Good Hobby Item Storage Case
customer_reviews.text: Excellent hobby case (I use mine for model building). Reasonably sturdy, and with all the variations in "tools" and things I don't want to throw away, and safe for later use, the extensive shelving and subdivisions in each are handy for certain. I would ask for one change which is why I took one star away. Make one small tray with VERTICAL spacing dividers (maybe spaced a little wider, instead of all having the HORIZONTAL dividers only. I have put some Dremel items in mine and some just can't fit well with the horizontal layout only. If I have something shaped like a quarter, you can't store it in here.
customer_reviews.author: J. A. Orr

customer_reviews.title: Awesome portable organization.
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic product. Organized all my screws from five different jars. It even had room for small boxes in the top compartment. The smaller slide out containers all lock and slide into the main interior on SLATS. they don't sit on top of each other so you can remove one of two and the others don't move. Well made. The door on the outside is on hinges and does not come off when open. .
customer_reviews.author: Angelo

customer_reviews.title: Solid construction and good price point.
customer_reviews.text: Solid construction and good price point. Great for my purpose as a first aid kit. Ample space for most items. I like that 2 of the drawers are 2.75" high. It's more like 13" wide and 13.5" high overall. Good quality plastics throughout. Front panel is kind of feeble but it is just to keep the drawers from flying out. There is a hole through the top compartment near the main clasp on the front that would enable you to loop a smaller diameter lock to prevent causal access to the main compartment on top. Very good over all deal.
customer_reviews.author: Mike JM

customer_reviews.title: Great organizer for small pieces!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to store my lamp repair parts, and I think it's fabulous. Very easy to use and I love having control over the size of the slots. The dividers fit well so I don't have small pieces ending up in the wrong slot. I can't think of anything negative. it closes securely, and it's nice to be able to remove one box without disturbing the others. The top is a good size so I have keep spools of wire and a few tools there. I have two--one for my husband's clock parts though he hasn't used his yet. He's not an organizer like myself so maybe I'll "borrow" his. Highly recommend if you have mainly small pieces.
customer_reviews.author: S. MatthewsTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: It's so  good - I bought a second one
customer_reviews.text: Convenient, but I would like to see one with all deep drawers with no compartment dividers. The second one seems a bit flimsier than the one I bought a few years ago. Still, a really nice item and provides good storage. Easy to move around.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Thin
customer_reviews.text: Good for what u need it for like rc parts computer components and other little hobby’s, but the material is thin and feels like it will break easily, it works perfect for my rc hobby but if I drop it, it will deffinetly break so be careful
customer_reviews.author: Andrew pope

customer_reviews.title: And it works well for what I need the top tray is great for all my tokens damage cards dice and my ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for the Star Wars x wing miniatures game. And it works well for what I need the top tray is great for all my tokens damage cards dice and my fire arch laser pointer. The bitten two trays are big enough for a lot of ships if you don't mind doubling up with like ships. The top compartment has my felt game mat all my bases move templates and a melenium falcon. It would be 5 stars however it doesn't come with enough dividers for the two gig trays and I would have to order more directly from Plano which I intend to do eventually. But because of that it lost a star
customer_reviews.author: Mark P.

customer_reviews.title: Great for jewelry making supplies
customer_reviews.text: As a jewelry designer these storage containers are perfect for storing all my jewelry supplies. They're sturdy enough for traveling and everyday use, and I love the fact that I can arrange the compartments to suit my needs.
customer_reviews.author: lynn stewart

customer_reviews.title: Great lightweight organizer.
customer_reviews.text: Great box and perfect for holding my Citadel paints and bits for Warhammer 40K. It is smaller than what I had imagined but that's not a downside. I read reviews before getting it and now understand what others meant about not getting enough dividers then again that would make your slots very narrow in my opinion. I can see how the front latch/door might fall off. If you're careful though it shouldn't so just take care of it.
customer_reviews.author: Justin N

customer_reviews.title: Great for rechargeable battery storeage
customer_reviews.text: I bought this box for storing my myriad of rechargeable batteries and spacers. It worked out really well. The fit in the spaces well. My only complaint is that this looked a lot larger in the picture and it was much smaller than I really wanted. That's my bad for not checking the dimensions, though.
customer_reviews.author: Jae

customer_reviews.title: works great
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this to hold my crafting supplies as I needed some more organization with plenty of compartments. It works great, and doesn't take up much space at all. The handle makes it easy to transport if needed.
customer_reviews.author: Addie Stevens

customer_reviews.title: Decent price for a decent product
customer_reviews.text: We bought this for our bow to put his rock collection in. He figured out the partitions all by himself. He's very proud of his (this) rock box. It's not a very large box so pay attention to the dimensions. For us it's perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Faith

customer_reviews.title: Size not explained
customer_reviews.text: Small..does not give size in description. I feel this is more for small items like safety pins, nails, bobby pins, thumbtacks. There is a top tray that will hold larger items. This would also be good for jewelry and crafts. Easy to carry.
customer_reviews.author: Anne Pearl

customer_reviews.title: Seems good so far.
customer_reviews.text: It has plenty of storage for my RC tools and spare parts. It's very durable so far and seems well made. The three containers come with spacers so you can create sections and make them whatever size you'd like.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda Witt

customer_reviews.title: Good storage for smaller places
customer_reviews.text: It's great storage container to hold all those things that ususally end up gotting lost in your tool box or if you don't have space to set up a bin system. I think the only thing that I don't like about is the dividers and how they you have to "unsnap" them. It leaves uneven ridges and you end up having take a utility blade to smooth it out. Other than that it's has enough compartments space to keep the most essential things for a house.
customer_reviews.author: R. Flores

customer_reviews.title: Works
customer_reviews.text: I like it. Somehow still smaller that I thought it would be. There is quite the size difference between the medium and large. I got the medium because that's what was available, but it works for me. I think the only thing I didn't really care for was how there was already some permanent dividers in the clear bins, more than I needed, but it didn't end up being a real problem. There were no other defects.
customer_reviews.author: Red Spirit

customer_reviews.title: Crappy plastic - Fit and finish
customer_reviews.text: Build quality is my number 1 hot button. This thing has weak plastics. The left side of the drawer keep does not close all the way. If you fish i guess maybe, but if you buy for tool and gadget organization i wouldnt recommend and may send it back, sometimes its just not worth the effort.
customer_reviews.author: Honeyman

customer_reviews.title: Nice compact size
customer_reviews.text: After seeing a similar item being compared this PLANO item in a knock-off store's ad, I brought this immediately. This company continues produce their products in the USA. This is just a little taller & wider than the opening of 5 gallon plastic bucket. If it is leaned forward, the four 3500 organizers slide out quickly. The top storage has slits for drainage/ventilation.
customer_reviews.author: ex-ESR Gary

customer_reviews.title: Compact. Nifty. Securely stores even the tiniest items/pieces/parts.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this item as a temporary stand but it turned out to be more useful than expected. Size was smaller than expected but that turned out to be an added benefit, It is compact and I store it in several places because the size makes it so nifty and easy to store almost anywhere and makes putting everything away a snap (almost literally).
customer_reviews.author: Ms. Webb

customer_reviews.title: Great little box
customer_reviews.text: This is a great little box I bought it to hold all my screws for my RC hobby and it does the job well I did end up gluing all the little slots in place overall I think it’s a great value and I would buy it again
customer_reviews.author: Lucky

customer_reviews.title: Wasted spaces
customer_reviews.text: Adequate for organizing small pieces. Not enough room in top compartment for normal sized tools. Lot's of wasted space that can't be utilized.
customer_reviews.author: Wigmaster0

customer_reviews.title: Nice little tackle box!
customer_reviews.text: My son really likes this box. It’s good for smaller lures. Make sure you read the Dimensions listed as it was a lot smaller then I thought. Fast and easy shipping with Prime!
customer_reviews.author: Andrea

customer_reviews.title: Great for storing Hardware
customer_reviews.text: I have 6 of these boxes and I use all of them for storing Hardware (nuts, bolts, screws etc.) I label the top of box the hardware type and each draw with the hardware sizes. I also plan on ordering some more boxes. They are great.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Wish the storage trays were more adjustable...
customer_reviews.text: I like the box, even though it is a little small. I think it is great for fishing trips, you can add or take away the "stowaways" for that trip. I wish the stowaways were more adjustable...a way to make them wider... the rows are alright but they are too narrow for larger hooks, etc. if you could adjust the width and the length of the compartments, instead of just the length, I think it would be a better system. Instead I had to us a saw blade and Dremel to make it work for me...
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: To small
customer_reviews.text: These are super small compared to the yellow one harbor fr***** has for just a few more dollars. Go there not there unless you got grains of rice your keeping
customer_reviews.author: Josh

customer_reviews.title: First Aid Storage Solution
customer_reviews.text: Purchased these to organize all of our first aid and athletic recovery gear. Carefully selected this item after reviewing several alternatives. A women's review of how she used this for her daughter's medication is what sold me on it - the pictures said it all. It's the right size for us with almost the perfect combination of compartment configurations. "Love it" is a strong descriptor and I'm not terribly generous on 5-stars, hence the 4-star rating, so let it be known that this product delivered as expected.
customer_reviews.author: BoilerShoeholic

customer_reviews.title: Okay, for the price (paid $26). It fits ...
customer_reviews.text: Okay, for the price (paid $26). It fits perfectly a small Hammer drill in the top shelf and screws drills below but it is NOT build for heavy Items. You have to stay below 20 pounds. My broke carrying 21 pounds.
customer_reviews.author: Stefan Karl Ruether

customer_reviews.title: High Quality 3/4 size
customer_reviews.text: Love the quality - a little on the small side but USA company and the quality - I recommend. I like the brown color as well.
customer_reviews.author: STL USA

customer_reviews.title: For Bigger Projects
customer_reviews.text: Ordered one of these after enjoying another product that was slightly smaller. This is a great box for larger products, tools and things that need to be kept together and available for slightly larger projects! Very happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Reader0111

customer_reviews.title: Can't adjust width of compartments in drawers
customer_reviews.text: Not noted anywhere (at least that registered with me) the insert "channels" in the drawers are fixed. You can adjust the length of the compartments you create but you can't change the width, which seriously reduces the usefulness of this product for me. I want to store tools in some of the drawers but can't since some won't fit. So, for me, this is a less than desirable design flaw. Otherwise, the product is exactly the size that I wanted.
customer_reviews.author: Sandy Fischler

customer_reviews.title: It’s small
customer_reviews.text: It’s a lot smaller than I expected . it’s also a different color and it is kinda cheap and crappy. I expected a lot more from Plano . All my tackle boxes are made by Plano this is #5 and it’s not as well made as my older ones.
customer_reviews.author: this pen sucks

customer_reviews.title: Has plenty of room, Great price.
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with this tackle box. Has plenty of room for a middle level fisherman. I haven't been in 20+ years and just bought a boat, so I'm just starting out again, and don't really see me needing anything bigger. Great price, came in on time, and does have the ability to lock the lid down, where I guess you can run a cable through it so no one could steal it if you leave it unattended at a dock or something... I like it very much. Great price.
customer_reviews.author: Jim C.

customer_reviews.title: Solid Gear
customer_reviews.text: I am going to use this case for some of my medical gear - dividing up pills, ointments, and such. The top container is great for bandages. A very solidly built case - I would buy it again if I needed another.
customer_reviews.author: M. R. D.

customer_reviews.title: Great for Dremel with lots of storage.
customer_reviews.text: I really like this tool box. My Dremel collection was getting out of hand with over 300 bits and accessories so I purchased this to house them all. I love it and all my Dremel stuff is now in one place. I love the 2 large storage bins that slide in and the one smaller one. The large ones are deeper than your average plastic storage box.
customer_reviews.author: Terry Morris

customer_reviews.title: Not great, not bad.
customer_reviews.text: Well. . . a few things. I got this as a sewing organizer, and not being able to take all of the dividers out of the bottom bins limits the usefulness. Also, the latch was completely off the top compartment. Easy enough for my handy daughter to snap back in, but the product shouldn't arrive in pieces. Also, read the dimensions carefully, know what you are getting. I think it would be great for a jewelry maker or someone who works with beads, not so much for sewing.
customer_reviews.author: Anonymous

customer_reviews.title: It's smaller than I thought
customer_reviews.text: Don't get me wrong. This was my fault not the sellers. I didn't pay close enough to the dimensions and in the picture it looked regular size. When I go it though is was a mini version of what I thought I was getting. I'll end up using it for something, it just wasn't exactly what I was looking for.
customer_reviews.author: Benjamin E. Briggs

customer_reviews.title: Very Small
customer_reviews.text: I should have checked the dimensions. The picture is very deceiving. This unit is the size of a lunch box. Super small.
customer_reviews.author: Joe D.

customer_reviews.title: Very Helpful
customer_reviews.text: So helpful, I bought this to organize screws, nails, bolts, washers, etc... in my garage. We had so many, in many different containers and they were all mixed together. Now they are all separated and divided into this container and if you need nails just pull out one container, or carry the whole thing in to have easy access to everything. I use the top to hold drywall anchors. I could have used one more drawer but that isn't anything against this box, I just have way to many little pieces of hardware :D
customer_reviews.author: Lindsy M. Carranza

customer_reviews.title: but it is a pretty light item
customer_reviews.text: Needed to organize all my gun cleaning tools, jags, rods, and other stuff. This was just the right size for what I needed. The picture made me think that the plastic would be thicker, but it is a pretty light item. The 3 trays come with dividers to section off the long side to side pockets. I think the only way I could beat this item is to go spend a lot of $ on a small Craftsman cabinet with roll out drawers. (I'm kinda of OCD about being organized.)
customer_reviews.author: George

customer_reviews.title: Ok Hobby box
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice little hobby Box, Although when mine came one of the hinge pins did not get put in correctly it was only 1/4 way through hinge and then it was sticking through the plastic on the inside and bent bad. I had to pull it out (was not easy) then straighten it, and reinstalled it through the hing. Also the top of the box has openings in it so you can not have small parts in the top section. they might fall out.
customer_reviews.author: Mark H.

customer_reviews.title: Decent Small, Portable Storage
customer_reviews.text: Like another purchaser, I wanted this to carry my tabletop miniatures. It works reasonably well for that purpose, though it gets only 4 stars because the optional dividers were too small to fit most models. They are removable, but it means my figures are loose in their rows. It still fits them fairly well and the removable containers are a handy feature for organizing.
customer_reviews.author: KM

customer_reviews.title: Dividers are useless
customer_reviews.text: I am using this for sewing notions. The latches work well, there's a good amount of space in the top where I put the sewing pedal and cords, scissors, etc. The dividers that came inside each of the three drawers didn't fit, so I tossed them. The three drawers have dividers, but if I wanted all cubes, I don't think the dividers would do a good job in keeping things in place anyway. Not a bad investment, it's easy to keep it close when I'm sewing.
customer_reviews.author: Lavagal

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for my needs but not too sturdy
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as I have a lot of loose nails, screws, nuts bolts, fittings, etc. This toolbox is great because I can easily access common tools on the top and all the little "things" fit neatly in an organized manner in the trays. No more loose "things" sliding around in my big tool box. I use this for the household but wouldn't trust it to take a beating in the bed of a truck or on a worksite. The tool box is a flimsy plastic and the front door more so. This is great to keep around the house but if you do improvements for a living, get something stronger.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Item was damaged when received. Damage is slight, ...
customer_reviews.text: Item was damaged when received. Damage is slight, does not affect function, but is noticeable on object. I ordered two of these, the first one was shipped to the wrong address, the second one was the damaged one. The rough edges leads me to believe the damage was after the item was crafted. As for functionality, it is smaller than I thought (I misread the size) but it will work still for what I need, so I have no complaint about the functionality.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick Schulz

customer_reviews.title: A jewelry box sold as a tackle box.
customer_reviews.text: This tackle box is great for a 6 year old. Picture is deceiving, I thought it would be a lot bigger. Its a quality box but way to small if your a avid fisherman. Read the small print. I'm very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: donald smith

customer_reviews.title: Great tool box for the money!
customer_reviews.text: I recently became interested in leather crafting. I needed something to organize my crafting tools in. This case is perfect. Well made and very sturdy. Some of my tools are heavy but it has held up well. Suits me fine. Will order another should the need arise. I like the fact that the top portion holds things like my 3 hammers and rotary punch. Lots of room. Great price and fast shipping.
customer_reviews.author: kittylover

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for board game models.
customer_reviews.text: I have become a fan of Plano molding. They make good quality stuff that is not over priced. This case and the model that is slightly smaller with 4 drawers it perfect for holding war hammer models. it will fit everything Except stuff that is obviously too big. You can fit 7 or 8 transports in the lid alone.Plano also makes cases that are comparable to pelican cases that i keep my rifles in. $60 for Plano or $220 for pelican. Same material, same size and shape, Slightly different design.
customer_reviews.author: james s.

customer_reviews.title: I like the design and t seems sturdy but I Really ...
customer_reviews.text: I like the design and t seems sturdy but I Really thought I was buying something bigger for all of my LED parts. Works well for the smaller stuff . I like the fact that you can remove the drawers without opening the top. Ive been using this for a rew months now and its held up well.
customer_reviews.author: AndrewCookiemonster

customer_reviews.title: Works for r me
customer_reviews.text: This is a great product to store small items in and keep organized. I keep lots of small parts, tools and cleaning supplies for knives and firearms in it. Works great, now all my stuff is in one place and I’m not looking all over for it!
customer_reviews.author: Aimee

customer_reviews.title: Faulty assembly
customer_reviews.text: Received and the toolbox was loose in the packaging, one hinge pin was not installed correctly. Looked like it was assembled hot and melted some of one hinge, I was able to re-insert the pin and it seems to work. Otherwise it is as expected.
customer_reviews.author: Lee

product_meta.title: Plano Molding 1363 Stow N Go Toolbox, Graphite Gray and Sandstone
product_meta.description:
Plano Molding's 1363 Stow N Go toolbox is a pro-rack organizer with a top toolbox, two deep 23630 removable Stowaway utility boxes, and one 23650 removable Stowaway utility box. A fold-down grate exposes the Stowaway organizers. It's manufactured with tension-lock latches for added security. Dimensions: 13. 25 inches by 9.6 inches by 13.75 inches. Plano 1363-30 Stow N Go Tool Box

FROM THE MANUFACTURER
Plano Molding's 1363 Stow N Go toolbox is a pro-rack organizer with a top toolbox, two deep 23630 removable StowAway utility boxes, and one 23650 removable StowAway utility box. A fold-down grate exposes the StowAway organizers. It's manufactured with tension-lock latches for added security. Dimensions: 13.375 inches by 14 inches by 10 inches.
feature_bullets: Ideal for storing and carrying tools and craft items

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.5 out of 5 stars669 ratings4.5 out of 5 stars
